title: How to Make Fried Tofu Sticks

steps.headline: Cut the tofu into finger-size strips.
steps.description: Think of extra-thick French fries, and you'll have the right idea of the size needed. Place on folded paper towels and cover with more paper towels. This step will wick away a lot of the moisture. If you like, you might even apply some weight like a plate. Taking away some moisture will give it a chewier texture and eliminate splatter when you fry them. (Don't discard the paper towels. Let them air dry and you can reuse them to wipe up spills.)

steps.headline: Mix the soya sauce and chili sauce together.
steps.description: Marinate the tofu in sauce for 30 plus minutes, depending on how flavorful you want it. If you removed some of the moisture, it will absorb the marinade quicker.

steps.headline: Mix together the breadcrumbs and cornstarch.
steps.description: Add salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Roll the tofu strips in the mixture.
Fill a deep frying pan or wok with oil.
steps.description: Fry the tofu strips until golden brown. Remove when cooked. If they seem greasy, place on kitchen towel to soak up any extra grease.

steps.headline: Make the dipping sauce.
steps.description: Simply mix all of the ingredients together and it's ready to go.

steps.headline: Serve the slightly cooled tofu sticks immediately.
steps.description: Dip tofu sticks into the dip and enjoy!

tyn: Utensil such as tongs for handling hot tofu sticks
